byline.contributor: J. David Goodman contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and VIVIAN YEE

abstract: New York State Legislature finishes its 2016 session with lackluster and disappointing results; Gov Andrew M Cuomo fails to push through several major initiatives, but he expresses satisfaction with his accomplishments; New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio fails to advance some agenda issues, facing Republican majority in Senate.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said “it was probably the most successful session in modern history,” despite falling short on proposals involving ethics and housing reform.

headline.main: Some Call Legislative Session a Letdown. Cuomo Sees It Far Differently.
headline.print_headline: Legislative Session Is Called a Letdown, but Cuomo Has a Much Different View

snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said “it was probably the most successful session in modern history,” despite falling short on proposals involving ethics and housing reform.
